title: Paper Nautilus Books
tagline: rare & recent books, art, oddments & ephemera
subject: Used books; New books; Rare books; Ephemera; Academic books; Art Books; H.P. Lovecraft; Literary criticism
location: Providence, Rhode Island; Northeast; New England
note: Greta gifted this bookmark to me after visiting a good friend in Providence a few years ago. I was surprised to find that I had never visited this store, though I lived close by for many years. I cannot even picture the storefront or imagine where it might be.

title: Symposium Books
tagline: New & Used Books (buy and sell), Vinyl Records
subject: Used books; New books; Vinyl records; Bicycle delivery; Art books; Cards; Gifts
location: Providence, Rhode Island; Northeast; New England
note: Symposium Books was my good friend while I was a summer camp counselor at Brown. On my days off, when the children were busy with class or a meal or a field trip, I would run downtown to Symposium Books where I could spend hours looking through art books that I didn't understand and $1 bargain books by long-forgotten poets.

title: The Next Chapter
tagline: An independent bookstore on Long Island. Used, rare, remaindered & new books, records, art.
subject: Used books; New books; Rare books; First editions; Vinyl records; Local Authors; Remainder books; Art; Ephemera
location: Huntington, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: The Next Chapter opened recently, after the long-standing local bookstore, The Book Revue, was forced to close its doors during the COVID-19 pandemic. Located on a busy corner, one could spend days listening to all of their used records. Favorite purchases of mine inclued Edward Lear's Complete Nonsense and Jane Ira Bloom's Second Wind.

title: The Bookstore and Get Lit Wine Bar
tagline: Serving the community since last Tuesday
subject: New books; Children's books; Art gallery; Wine bar; Local authors
location: Lenox, Massachusetts; Northeast; New England
note: Though I did not have a glass of wine at the Get Lit Wine bar, I plan to return one day and sit at their tiny bar, reading and drinking whatever natural wine their bartender wants to serve me.

title: Book Culture
tagline: Indie Bookstore in LIC, Queens
subject: New books; Used books; Rare books; Academic books; Textbooks; Gifts; Children's books
location: Long Island City, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: I cannot remember when or why I went to this bookstore, only that this bookmark has been in my collection for many years.

title: Greenlight Bookstore
tagline: An independent bookstore in the heart of Brooklyn
subject: New books; Used books; Signed copies; First editions; Children's books
location: Brooklyn, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: Gifted to my by Greta, I remember coming across this store on a walk one day. In search of magazines, I was not successful in acquiring any here but I did spend quite a bit of time leafing through an impressive selection of cookbooks.

title: McNally Jackson: Brooklyn
tagline: Independent Booksellers
subject: New books; Stationary; Gifts; Signed copies; Cafe
location: Brooklyn, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: The McNally Jackson in Brooklyn is a lofted space with a cafe. I visited on a blustery winter day and purchases a webcam cover (with a tiger on it) and was tempted to purchse ISOLARII's [Modern Animal](https://www.stackmagazines.com/current-affairs/modern-animal/) but the price tag deterred me.

title: Troubled Sleep
tagline: A wide variety of quality books at low prices. Best pices paid for used books!
subject: Literary fiction; Used books; New books; Philosophy; Art books
location: Brooklyn, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: Named for Sartre's La mort dans l'âme, the walls of this bookstore are filled ceiling to floor with used and new books on a variety of topics. With a bit of Brooklyn humor (see the geographic section broken down into 'New York' and 'Rest of the Stupid Country'), I always find an interesting and thought-provoking book on these shelves.

title: The Word Is Change
tagline: Books, Used + New
subject: Used books; New books; Visual Arts
location: Brooklyn, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: I dawdled here before meeting someone at Oddly Enough, just down the street. I bought a copy of Ben Lerner's Leaving Atocha Station and a selection of John Ruskin's works (this is back when I thought I would go to graduate school for Victorian literature). I told the owner that I was moving to the midwest and her excitedly exclaimed, I'll buy all the books you won't bring with you! As I was just visiting Brooklyn, I couldn't take him up on his offer.

title: Codex
tagline: Specializing in art and literary fiction, both classic and contemporary. Best prices paid for used books
subject: Art books; Literary fiction; Used books; New books; Cafe
location: New York City, New York; Northeast; Middle Atlantic
note: I bought the coolest book that I have ever thrifted at Codex. On a bookstore spree before I moved to Indiana, I found a copy of Angela Lorenz's The Theater of Nature or Curiosity Filled the Cabinet tucked into a corner, next to the zines and sulf-published chapbooks. I purchased the fantastic acordian book for $9 and it is on display in my home to this day.
